turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1940 Nova Scotia hurricane.
turn.1: What happened in the 1940 Nova Scotia hurricane?
turn.2: In Saint John, chimneys were toppled.
turn.4: Flying debris injured several people, and power outages also greatly affected the city.
turn.6: High waves in conjunction with strong gusts scattered boats in the nearby Saint John River.
turn.8: Tents in the Sussex Military Camp were destroyed.
turn.10: The hurricane's effects resulted in a car accident which injured eight people.
turn.12: Though no fatalities were confirmed in New Brunswick, a person went missing in Bathurst, who was later presumed dead.
